subject: Self Care
title: Nightmares and What They Mean
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Nightmares and What They Mean.

hook.text: You're falling, being chased, teeth crumbling. Nightmares feel real because the brain treats them as real.

buildup.text: Nightmares occur during REM sleep when the emotional brain is highly active but logic is suppressed.

discovery.text: Stress, trauma, and certain medications are the most common nightmare triggers in adults.

twist.text: Some researchers believe nightmares serve a purpose: rehearsing threats so waking life feels less scary.

climax.text: Imagery rehearsal therapy lets you rewrite nightmare scripts while awake, reducing their frequency.

punchline.text: Nightmares are treatable. You can rewrite them.

quiz.question: What is imagery rehearsal therapy?
options: Rewriting nightmare scripts while awake to reduce them
